alert.note: Alert for Comanche; Kiowa; Tillman (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 05 at 12:54AM CDT until May 05 at 1:45AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: The National Weather Service in Norman has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Western Comanche County in southwestern Oklahoma... South central Kiowa County in southwestern Oklahoma... Northeastern Tillman County in southwestern Oklahoma... * Until 145 AM CDT. * At 1254 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 7 miles southeast of Cooperton to 9 miles northwest of Cache to 3 miles southwest of Indiahoma to 5 miles east of Manitou to 10 miles northeast of Frederick, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Lawton, Cache, Elgin, Medicine Park, Indiahoma, Fort Sill, Meers, Lake Lawtonka, Lake Ellsworth and Wichita Mountains Wildlife Refuge. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect for the warned area. Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
